edu.ucla.sspace.clustering
Class StreamingKMeans<T extends DoubleVector>

java.lang.Object
  edu.ucla.sspace.clustering.StreamingKMeans<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Generator<OnlineClustering<T>>
public class StreamingKMeans<T extends DoubleVector>
extends Object
implements Generator<OnlineClustering<T>>

An implementation of a simple, highly accurate streaming K Means algorithm. It is based on a the following paper:

  • Braverman, V., Meyerson, A., Ostrovsky, R., Roytman, A., Shindler, M., and Tagiku, B. Streaming k-means on Well-Clusterable Data. In Proceedings of SODA. 2011, 26-40. Available online here

A key feature of this algorithm is that only one pass is made through a data set. It is intended for applications where the total number of data points is known, but can be used if a rough estimate of the data points is known. This algorithm periodically reformulates the centroids by performing an batch form of K Means over the centroids, and potentially a sample of data points assigned to each centroid, clearing out all centroids, and then treating the old centroids as new heavily weighted data points. This process happens automatically when one of several thresholds are passed.

Author:
Keith Stevens
